Docs.summary: Defines methods and properties for writing a .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.AddFixedDocumentSequence%2A> method in order to obtain a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence> writer for adding <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> content to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Commit method to flush and close the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence> writer.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

Docs.summary: Sets a for the that is being written.
Docs.value: A that represents a default printing configuration for the sequence.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property does not validate or modify the specified <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a specified printer.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the PrintTicket property to associate a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence>.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]
